Package edu.uno.ai.sat

Class Assignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uno.ai.sat.Assignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Substitution, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class Assignment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Substitution
    Represents a (full or partial) solution to a satisfiability Problem. Initially, all variables are set to unknown.
    Author:
    Stephen G. Ware

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      SearchBudget budget
      The search budget, which constrains how many time variable values may be set and how much time may be spent finding a solution
      Problem problem
      The problem this assignment is associated with

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected Assignment​(Assignment toClone)
      Creates a new assignment that is a clone of the given assignment.

        public Proposition toProposition()

        the proposition

      • getValue

        public Value getValue​(Variable variable)
        Returns the current Value of a variable in the formula. This operation runs in constant time.
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable whose value is to be checked
        Returns:
        the variable's current value

      • countTrueLiterals

        public int countTrueLiterals​(Clause clause)
        Returns the number of literals that are currently true in a given clause. This operation runs in constant time.
        Parameters:
        clause - the clause for which the true literals should be counted
        Returns:
        the number of true literals in the clause

      • countFalseLiterals

        public int countFalseLiterals​(Clause clause)
        Returns the number of literals that are currently false in a given clause. This operation runs in constant time.
        Parameters:
        clause - the clause for which the false literals should be counted
        Returns:
        the number of false literals in the clause

      • countUnknownLiterals

        public int countUnknownLiterals​(Clause clause)
        Returns the number of literals whose current values is not known to be true or false in the given clause. This operation runs in constant time.
        Parameters:
        clause - the clause for which the unknown literals should be counted
        Returns:
        the number of unknown literals

      • countTrueClauses

        public int countTrueClauses()
        Returns the number of clauses that are currently true in the problem this assignment is associated with. This operation runs in constant time. The number of true clauses is often used as a simple measure of the quality of an assignment.
        Returns:
        the number of true clauses

      • countFalseClauses

        public int countFalseClauses()
        Returns the number of clauses that are currently false in the problem this assignment is associated with. This operation runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the number of false clauses

      • countUnknownClauses

        public int countUnknownClauses()
        Returns the number of clauses whose value is not currently known in the problem this assignment is associated with. This operation runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the number of unknown clauses

      • getValue

        public Value getValue​(Literal literal)
        Returns the Value of a given literal. This operation runs in constant time.
        Parameters:
        literal - the literal whose value is to be checked
        Returns:
        the value

      • getValue

        public Value getValue​(Clause clause)
        Returns the Value of a given clause. This operation runs in constant time.
        Parameters:
        clause - the clause whose value is to be checked
        Returns:
        the value

      • getValue

        public Value getValue()
        Returns the Value of the logical formula for the problem this assignment is associated with. This operation runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the value

      • setValue

        public void setValue​(Variable variable,
                     Value value)
        Sets the Value of the given variable. This operation runs in linear time equal to the number of literals the variable appears. Each time this operation is performed, the search budget's operations is reduced by one.
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable whose value will be set
        value - the value the variable will be set to
